title: Claudio Ranieri becomes manager of Sampdoria in Serie A
text:
Ranieri signed contract until 2021 and his first game in charge is against Roma

They turned to former Premier League-winning manager Claudio Ranieri

Claudio Ranieri has been unveiled as the new manager of Serie A's bottom-placed side Sampdoria.

He has chosen to take his next step with the Liguria club having been out of a job since working as Roma's interim boss last season.

The 67-year-old signed a contract until 2021 and was welcomed by controversial president Massimo Ferrero.

Claudio Ranieri (left) signed as the new Sampdoria boss alongside president Massimo Ferrero

The announcement was tweeted on Sampdoria's account. They also posted the message: 'Dilly Ding, Dilly Dong', in reference to the imaginary bell he used to get the attention of Leicester players.

Ranieri left the Foxes in February of 2017 having won the Premier League the season before.

He's since had spells at Nantes and Fulham before stepping in to take control of Roma on an interim basis last term, where he was adored by the fans.

Sampdoria have been struggling this season and need Ranieri to revive their fortunes

Sampdoria will offer an altogether different challenge to the veteran Italian.

They have won only once and lost six games this season in Serie A, lying at the foot of the table.

Fortunately for Ranieri, they have not yet been cut adrift and 17th-placed SPAL are only three points ahead.
description: Claudio Ranieri has been revealed as the new manager of Serie A's bottom-placed side Sampdoria. He has chosen to take his next step with the Liguria club.
